page.title: 09Geography-Calverton area
page.content: PHYSICAL GEOGRAPHY-The area was gently undulating and varied in height above sea level from 69 ft to 89 ft.There was no large natural wood cover but small copses and odd trees were dotted around. The River Great Ouse flowed through our area in a SW -NE direction. For 1.5 kilometres near Passenham the river split and followed two courses before rejoining east of Passenham. There were some water filled gravel pits at 47722389(National Grid co-ordinates).The soil in and around Calverton was very clayey,and largely suitable for rough grazing with some arable farming possible.
